title: Crucial US Senate races to follow
description: With control of the Senate on the line, all eyes are on these tight contests

title: Gun hidden in a raw chicken found at Florida TSA checkpoint
description: A gun found inside a raw chicken at an airport security checkpoint has the TSA calling "personal fowl."

title: 'Executed in silence': Zelensky on counteroffensive against Russia
description: CNN's Christiane Amanpour asks Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky about the status of Ukraine's counteroffensive against Russia's occupation of Kherson. Watch the full interview airing on Thursday on CNN International at 1 p.m. ET.

title: Zelensky speaks to CNN on America's continued support for Ukraine
description: CNN's Christiane Amanpour joins President Volodymyr Zelensky and Olena Zelenska amid the United States' midterm elections and what they hope support for Ukraine looks like with shifts in the US Congress. Watch the full interview airing on Thursday on CNN International at 1 p.m. ET.

title: Tim Kaine on 2022 midterms: 'It's going to be a tough two years' for Republicans
description: The former Democratic vice presidential candidate says the GOP is grappling with the reality of President Trump's lock on a 'huge portion' of the party.

title: New study finds octopuses are capable of surprisingly human-like behavior
description: A team of researchers in Australia observed octopuses deliberately throwing debris over 100 times in 2015 and 2016.

title: Legendary Brazilian singer Gal Costa dies at age 77
description: Brazilian singer Gal Costa, one of the most influential artists in Brazil's Tropicalia movement of the 1960s, died on Wednesday. She was 77 years old.

title: Breaking down the significant turmoil that's unfolded in the Oath Keepers trial
description: The seditious conspiracy trial of five alleged Oath Keepers leaders has become mired in conflict as prosecutors called defense witnesses to warn them against self-incrimination in the days before they take the stand, defense attorneys accused one another of unethical conduct and one witness was revealed to be an informant.

title: Biden set to take a midterm victory lap even as key races remain close
Webb telescope captures 'bejeweled' image of dwarf galaxy
description: The James Webb Space Telescope has snapped a remarkably detailed image of a nearby dwarf galaxy. The near-infrared view reveals the deepest glimpse yet into a stellar panorama that could offer astronomers an ideal means of studying aspects of the early universe.

title: Adidas will continue to sell Kanye West's shoe designs without the Yeezy name
description: Adidas ended its sneaker partnership with Ye, formerly known as Kanye West, last month after the musician's anti-Semitic tirade. But Adidas will continue to sell the lucrative sneaker and apparel line, stripped of the Yeezy name and branding.

title: Three Americans found dead from carbon monoxide poisoning at Mexico City Airbnb, official says
description: Three Americans died from carbon monoxide poisoning while staying at a rented apartment in Mexico City, the city attorney general's office said.

title: This railway links China to Laos
description: Part of China's "Belt and Road Initiative," the 621-mile railway connects Kunming to Vientiane.

title: Crucial US Senate races to follow
description: With control of the Senate on the line, all eyes are on these tight contests

title: Hear GOP lawmaker's prediction about Trump and McCarthy's relationship
description: Rep. Adam Kinzinger (R-IL) talks to CNN's Anderson Cooper about the midterm election results and how Republicans should be reassessing former president Donald Trump's role in the party.

title: Energy security trumps the climate? London's biggest IPO of the year is an oil company
description: The world may be losing the fight against the climate crisis, but investors are still willing to throw money at oil and gas companies.

title: Why Vienna is promoting itself with a belly on legs
description: The Austrian capital is staging a comeback with a surreal ad campaign.

title: Jennifer Aniston opens up about failed IVF and says she has 'zero regrets'
description: Jennifer Aniston has opened up about her failed attempts to get pregnant, saying she has "zero regrets" about a difficult period in her life.

title: Youngkin sent Pelosi a handwritten note apologizing for comments about attack on husband
description: Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin sent a handwritten note of apology to House Speaker Nancy Pelosi for comments he made after the assault on her husband Paul Pelosi, her spokesperson told CNN.

title: Bitcoin tumbles as investors panic over FTX failure
description: The fallout in cryptocurrencies deepened Wednesday as investors were shaken by the failure of one of the sector's most hyped companies.

title: Germany blocks sale of chip factory to China over security fears
description: The German government has blocked the sale of one of its semiconductor factories to a Chinese-owned tech company because of security concerns.

title: Bodycam video: Deputies mistake legally blind man's walking stick for a gun and arrest him
description: Two Florida deputies were suspended without pay after mistaking a legally blind man's walking stick for a pistol and arresting him on charges later dropped.

title: Russia's penal colonies are often grim, cramped facilities. Here's what could await Brittney Griner
The Iowa teen who killed her alleged rapist and escaped from a residential corrections facility is back in custody
description: Pieper Lewis, the Iowa teen and sex trafficking victim who killed a man she said raped her multiple times, is back in custody following her escape from the residential corrections facility where she was serving probation, according to the Polk County Sheriff's Office.

title: US climate envoy Kerry announces -- and is immediately criticized for -- a new carbon offset plan for companies
description: US climate envoy John Kerry announced a new, controversial plan Wednesday to raise cash for climate action in the developing world -- by selling carbon credits to companies wishing to offset their polluting emissions.

title: 10 tips to manage uncertainty and stress around the midterm elections
description: Well-meaning advice for people stressing out about current events often includes encouragement to be patient, stay calm and keep the faith -- but how on Earth are you supposed to do that when the onslaught of troubling news seems never to stop?

title: Winners and losers from the 2022 election so far
description: Oh, what a night!

title: Ryan Murphy reflects on the death of 'Glee' star Cory Monteith
description: Ryan Murphy says he now would have handled the death of "Glee" star Cory Monteith differently.

title: The view from Europe on America's 'red tsunami' that wasn't
description: On newspaper stands across the French capital and online, the early results of America's national elections were quite evident Wednesday morning.

title: Cargo spacecraft docks with ISS after solar panel fails to deploy
description: A cargo spacecraft successfully docked with the International Space Station Wednesday morning, despite making its two-day trek through space with only one functioning solar panel.

title: Jennifer Lopez praises Jennifer Garner's co-parenting with Ben Affleck
description: Newlyweds Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck have a blended family and it sounds like things are going well.

title: Europe still can't live without this Russian energy export
description: Europe may be closer than ever to breaking its energy dependence on Moscow, but it still can't live without one type of Russian natural gas.

title: Crucial US Senate races to follow
description: With control of the Senate on the line, all eyes are on these tight contests

title: 'Black Panther: Wakanda Forever' celebrates diverse culture and heritage
description: "Wakanda Forever," the sequel to "Black Panther," Marvel Studios' award-winning $1.3 billion grossing movie, had its African premiere in Nigeria -- the first time Marvel has held an African premiere there.

title: Layoffs could weaken Twitter in its biggest global growth markets
description: It's less than two weeks since Elon Musk completed his acquisition of Twitter and already there are concerns that the company is choosing to ignore key risks in its biggest international growth markets.

title: Dan McCafferty, original lead singer of rock band Nazareth, dead at 76
description: Dan McCafferty, the original lead singer of Scottish hard rock band Nazareth, has died aged 76, his band has confirmed.

title: Kari Lake raises unfounded doubts about results in Arizona governor race
description: Democrat Katie Hobbs is leading Republican Kari Lake in Arizona governor's race with a little more than half of precincts reporting, and though much could change as ballots are counted, the GOP nominee is already casting doubt about the election results.

title: Control of House and Senate hangs in balance as nation watches key races
Markets are in trouble. Election results won't change that
description: The results of Tuesday's midterm elections will set the agenda for the next Congress. That could mean changes to fiscal policy, which uses taxes and government spending to influence a country's economy.

title: Princess Märtha Louise of Norway gives up royal duties to run business with shaman fiancé
description: Norway's Princess Märtha Louise is withdrawing from official royal duties in order to concentrate on the alternative medicine business she runs with her fiancé, American spiritual guru Durek Verrett.

title: See how Arizona county is processing votes as crucial Senate race remains undecided
description: In Maricopa County, Arizona, an updated vote count is not expected until tonight in a pivotal race that could determine control of the US Senate. Workers are now processing early ballots in the state's most populous county. CNN's Victor Blackwell has more. All CNN viewers can watch live coverage of the midterm elections here.

title: Magnitude 5.7 earthquake shakes Italy's Adriatic coast
Baltimore Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson brings young fan with heart condition to tears with kind gesture
description: It was a Monday Night Football match to remember for one NFL fan thanks to Lamar Jackson

title: AN-225: Plans to rebuild world's largest plane confirmed
description: For avgeeks, the destruction of the world's largest commercial plane was one of the key images at the start of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. In February, the Antonov AN-225 was attacked at its base in Hostomel, near Kyiv.

title: 'Perhaps a pink trickle': Late night shows go live on election night
description: Jimmy Kimmel and Stephen Colbert took their shows live on election night, sharing the earliest midterm results.

title: Facebook parent company Meta will lay off 11,000 employees
description: Facebook parent company Meta on Wednesday said it is laying off 11,000 employees, marking the most significant job cuts in the tech giant's history.

title: Two teaspoons of lab-made blood could have enormous potential for people with rare blood conditions
description: Scientists have transfused lab-made red blood cells into a human volunteer in a world-first trial that experts say has major potential for people with hard-to-match blood types or conditions such as sickle cell disease. The research could someday mean an end to long searches for compatible donors or dangerous transfusion reactions.

title: Ice hockey star Evander Kane in 'stable' condition after opponent accidentally skates over his wrist
description: Edmonton Oilers forward Evander Kane was rushed to the hospital after suffering a deep cut to his left wrist during his team's win against the Tampa Bay Lightning on Tuesday.

title: Republicans fall short of expectations with the Democrats flipping a crucial Senate seat and House still up for grabs
How Nikki Hiltz is making running more inclusive for LGBTQ people
description: Running in the quiet, in those spaces between footsteps when both feet are in mid-air and flying for a millisecond, Nikki Hiltz figured out their gender identity.

title: China is 'committed to net zero,' head of top Asian development bank says at COP27
description: China and the other 104 members of the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank are "deeply committed" to their net-zero targets, says the chief of the continent's largest multilateral development bank.

title: Gerard Piqué and Robert Lewandowski sent off as Barcelona fights back to defeat Osasuna
description: Gerard Piqué's football career ended in ignominious fashion as he was red carded from the substitute's bench, but Barcelona nevertheless secured an important 2-1 victory against Osasuna.

title: Stressed? Try taking a 'breathing break' with these 6 techniques
description: Stressful situations are a part of everyday life, but it can be a challenge managing the daily grind without feeling the heat. Whether you're stuck in traffic or in an anxiety-inducing thought pattern, your body's stress response naturally kicks in — breathing becomes rapid, your heart races, and blood pressure rises.

title: The skincare brand betting on CBD beauty in the Middle East
description: When mother-son entrepreneurs Yann Moujawaz and Juana Martini launch their skincare brand in the United Arab Emirates this winter, they will be the first to market CBD-based products to a region well-known for its zero-tolerance approach to drugs.

title: Qatar World Cup 'is a mistake,' says former FIFA President Sepp Blatter
description: Sepp Blatter, the former president of FIFA when Qatar was awarded the 2022 World Cup hosting rights in 2010, told Swiss newspaper Tages Anzeiger "Qatar is a mistake," adding that "the choice was bad."

title: Guangzhou locks down second district as China's Covid outbreak widens
description: China's southern metropolis of Guangzhou has locked down a second district, as authorities rush to stamp out a widening Covid outbreak and avoid activating the kind of citywide lockdown that devastated Shanghai earlier this year.

title: Anatomy of a close election: How Americans voted in 2022 vs. 2018
'That's not a red wave': John King explains what he sees so far
description: CNN's John King says that even though Republicans are still favored to take control of the US House of Representatives in the US midterm elections, this is not the 'red wave' predicted by many experts because Democrats are performing better than expected in many districts.

title: North Korea launches ballistic missile, says South Korean military
description: North Korea launched a ballistic missile towards waters off its east coast on Wednesday, according to South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff.

title: Brittney Griner begins transfer to Russian penal colony, attorneys say
description: US women's basketball star Brittney Griner is in the process of being moved to a Russian penal colony where she is due to serve the remainder of a nine-year drug smuggling sentence that was upheld in late October.

title: 'Not the normal midterm election': David Axelrod reacts to voting night trends
description: Former Obama adviser, David Axelrod, reacts to the voting trends so far in the midterm elections as the results continue to defy predictions of a Republican red wave.

title: CNN projects Fetterman to beat Oz. Analysts examine how he did it
description: CNN is projecting that Democratic Pennsylvania Lt. Gov. John Fetterman will beat Trump-backed Republican Dr. Mehmet Oz to pick up a Senate seat in the US midterm elections. CNN's Dana Bash, Abby Philip, and Chris Wallace analyze what happened.

title: Zelensky says 'fierce battles' rage in eastern Ukraine, with Russian forces suffering large-scale losses
Crucial US Senate races to follow
description: With control of the Senate on the line, all eyes are on these tight contests

title: Ex-Trump official: Election shows that Trump is holding GOP back
description: Alyssa Farah Griffin, who served as the White House communications director under former President Donald Trump, says that the midterm election results show that Republicans have to to divorce themselves of Trump if they want to thrive.

title: Herschel Walker, Raphael Warnock locked in too-early-to-call Georgia Senate race
description: The hotly contested Senate contest in Georgia is too early to call nearly six hours after most polls closed in the state, with Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnock and Republican challenger Herschel Walker locked in a tight race that could decide control of the US Senate.

title: French Polynesia to cap tourist numbers
description: The beautiful islands of French Polynesia might become more difficult to visit as the region announces a new sustainable tourism plan.

title: Italy hails 'exceptional' discovery of ancient bronze statues in Tuscany
description: Archaeologists in Italy have uncovered more than two dozen beautifully preserved bronze statues dating back to ancient Roman times in thermal baths in Tuscany, in what experts are hailing as a sensational find.

title: Takeaways from the 2022 midterm elections
description: The battle for control of Congress is beginning to take shape as votes are counted in competitive races across the nation.

title: CNN analyst: Here's what DeSantis' projected victory could mean for the GOP
description: Gov. Ron DeSantis will win a second term leading Florida, CNN projects. CNN's political panel breaks down his message to the GOP with his resounding victory.

title: Egypt faces an acute water crisis, but it's building a 'Green River' in the desert
description: On the easternmost outskirts of Cairo, the Egyptian government is building a giant belt of lakes and parks deep in the desert. Creators call it the "Green River" and say that when finished, the ornamental ribbon will cut through Egypt's brand new, ultra-modern metropolis: its New Administrative Capital.

title: Bronze Age comb reveals an ancient frustration with head lice
description: A seven-word inscription discovered by accident on a 3,700-year-old lice comb is the oldest known sentence written in an alphabet, according to a new study.

title: Covid restrictions cloud airshow debut of China's Comac C919 jet
description: China staged a low-key but historic debut of its C919 civil jet at its biggest airshow on Tuesday, with some delegates unable to attend the scaled-down event because of Beijing's zero-Covid policy as cases reached the highest level in six months.

title: What's a blue and red wave? CNN's John King explains at the magic wall
description: CNN's John King breaks down how competitive House of Representatives races can help to predict the party breakdown of Congress. All CNN viewers can now watch live coverage of the midterm elections here.

title: Alibaba's Jack Ma and China's super-rich see billions wiped off fortunes as economy slows
description: China's super-rich saw their wealth tumble by the most in over two decades this year, as the Russia-Ukraine war, Beijing's zero-Covid measures and falling mainland and Hong Kong stock markets pummeled fortunes, according to an annual rich list.

title: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis wins reelection and Katie Britt becomes the first woman elected to the Senate in Alabama
New semi-high-speed train makes this land-locked nation more accessible than ever
description: The train is just north of Vang Vieng when the sound of a woman crying echoes through the carriage.

title: One Indian family lost 12 members in the Morbi bridge collapse
description: A marigold garland hangs across a photo frame with the faces of 12 members of the Bodha family who died when a bridge collapsed beneath them during a family outing in Gujarat, eastern India.

title: Four 2022 election conspiracies, fact-checked
description: False claims and conspiracy theories about voting and the election process swirled on social media as Americans cast their ballots on Tuesday.

title: See Iranian soccer player appear to protest during tournament
description: Iran's football authorities have vowed to deal with beach soccer players who showed solidarity with Iranian protesters during an international tournament. Iran won the Emirates Intercontinental Beach Soccer Cup on Sunday, beating Brazil in the final after Saeed Piramoon scored the winning goal. Piramoon imitated cutting his hair -- a move signaling support for protests in the country.

title: Voters casting final ballots to determine control of House, Senate and 36 governor races
Twitter to debut gray 'official' check mark to verify government accounts, media and major brands
description: Twitter said Tuesday evening that to resolve ambiguity about which accounts on its platform have been identity-verified — as opposed to those simply paying $8 a month for a blue check mark on their profiles — the company will introduce a new, gray check mark as part of an "official" label.

title: CNN contributors offer live commentary on Election Night
Western Nepal hit by magnitude 5.6 earthquake killing at least five people, say officials
description: A magnitude 5.6 earthquake hit western Nepal on Wednesday morning local time, killing at least five people, according to local officials.
